channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Oven dumped on pavement, 26th September
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping in 1-8 Redding House bin store, 26th September
item.description:
A tenant moved out of a flat in block 9-16 Redding House on Sunday 21st September. He has left huge amounts of broken up furniture and a mattress in the bin store for 1-8 Redding House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-28, Harlinger Street, Charlton Riverside, London

item.title: Lime obstructing footpath, 26th September
item.description:
Lime bike placed directly across a narrow footpath at a junction, making it impassable, and significantly increasing danger for pedestrians.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Appold Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stolen Bike, 26th September
item.description:
Reported this stolen motorbike to the Police on Monday CAD5404 the number plate HT17 EPC is coming up as a red scotter Honder. This is a black motorbike. Its been here all week. It's in a residential parking bay for the flats and its attracting anti social behaviour. We need this parking space back and the Bike removed. Police weren't interested when we reported. Said to contact yourselves to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bournewood Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess rubbish, 26th September
item.description:
The communal bins are over flowing. The area around it is over flowing both rubbish. It is an absolute disgrace and a health hazard. I have just seen rats there, children play close by and this is extremely dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waltham Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Burlington house garden wall in Wedderburn Road NW35QS, 26th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Wedderburn Road, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Motorcycles on the lovely new paving, 26th September
item.description:
The new pacing on the pedestrianised part of Scylla Road looks lovely but there are already motorbikes zooming down it, only a few hours after the work was finished. There needs to be something to prevent them or at least slow them down as it is really dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84-96, Scylla Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (8). Summary includes number of times same recurring offence reported since 16/09/2025. This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris., 26th September
item.description:
The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders- ‚Äú Westminster City Council issued zero Fixed Penalty Notices (FPNs) for fly-tipping in the 2023-24 period, according to data from GOV.UK. While the council has the power to issue FPNs, they did not use this specific enforcement measure in the most recent reporting year‚Äù üßê

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed gas safety inspection, 26th September
item.description:
This is fairly normal for Hackney gas services to miss appointments and be quite rude about it. Saying they don‚Äôt know why they missed the appointment but you don‚Äôt have any other option than to stay home all day and let us in or we will force entry.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
